text: Tony Danza (born Anthony Salvatore Iadanza; April 21, 1951 in Brooklyn, New York) is an American actor, producer and boxer. His mother was an immigrant from Sicily; his father was a sanitation worker. Danza made his big screen debut in the 1981 movie Going Ape!. Danza was also the host of the ESPY Awards in 1996 and Miss America in 2002. ==Filmography== *Going Ape! as Foster (1981) *Cannonball Run II as Terry (1984) *Mr. Thompson and His Bananas as Geraldo Thompson (1988) *She's Out of Control as Doug Simpson (1989) *I'm From Hollywood (1992) (Cameo) *Angels in the Outfield as Mel Clark (1994) *Illtown as D'Avalon (1996) *Dear God as Himself (1996) *Glam as Sid (1997) *The Girl Gets Moe as Moe (1997) *A Brooklyn State of Mind as Louie Crisci (1997) *Meet Wally Sparks as New York Cab Driver (1997) *The Garbage Picking Field Goal Kicking Philadelphia Phenomenon as Barney Gorman (1998) *The Whisper as Simon (2004) *Crash as Fred (2005) *The Nail: The Story of Joey Nardone as Chickie (2009) *Aftermath as King (2009) *Firedog as Rocky (2010) ==References== == Other websites == * Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from New York City Category:American boxers Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Sportspeople from New York City Category:American teachers Category:Educators from New York City
